“The high winds and snow caused a tree in my yard to fall; it crashed through a portion of my bedroom.” Standing up, I walked over to Ashley and said, “I’ve been scared of storms ever since; even a small thunderstorm is enough to freak me out.”

“You know we’re safe down here, right?” looking at me, Ashley said, “Nothing on the surface can harm us down here.”

“I-I know.” Sighing, I said, “Thanks for making me feel better.”

“Hey, that’s what family is for.”

I’d already started back to work when Ashley had said that. I turned around to look at her, “What did you say?”

“That’s what friends are for.”

I knew that wasn’t what she said, but before I could press her on it there was a loud noise on the surface and the entire bunker shook violently.
111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Storm

1111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I instinctively went to protect Ashley as the shaking caused some plants to fall on the ground. The lights flickered for a moment as the entire bunker shook. Once everything stopped shaking, and the lights returned to normal, I looked at Ashley said, “Are you alright?”

“I’m a little shaken, pun intended.” Flicking some dirt from her hair, Ashley said, “How about you?”

Looking at the half a dozen plants on the ground, I turned back to Ashley. “I’m better off than those plants.”

“Do you think you can save most of them?”

“I think so.” Pointing to a nearby cabinet, I said, “There are some extra containers in there, I’ll try to transplant what I can.”

At the moment the sound of Caleb screaming reached us. Rushing to the door, Ashley said, “I’m going to check on Caleb, call me if you need any help.”

**********************


It took all of 25 minutes to replant the vegetables in the new containers. After washing the dirt off my hands, I walked into the main room where I saw Ashley sitting on the couch; with Caleb huddled against her. “He’s fine, don’t worry.” Looking at me, Ashley said, “Just a little shaken is all.”

After placing an affectionate hand on Caleb’s back, I looked at Ashley and said, “I know we said it wasn’t a good idea, but I think we need to take the drone out.” Going to grab the controller, I said, “We need to find out if there’s any damage that could prevent us from leaving once the time comes.”

“I’d rather you didn’t, but I guess we don’t have a choice.” Gently moving Caleb off her, Ashley got up and walked over to me. “Promise me it’ll just be a quick flight; check for damage and then bring it back.”

The drone was airborne a few minutes later; flying out over the lawn. The first thing I noticed was a sizable number of branches, even several toppled trees, on the ground. They must’ve been weakened by Samson’s impact; the storm was just too much for them.

Unfortunately, the damage wasn’t limited to the yard; a large tree had fallen on the rear of the house, destroying the kitchen and the family room in the process. From what I could tell, the garage area was still relatively intact; nothing was preventing us from leaving the bunker when the time came.

As I flew the drone around the front of the house, I noticed something on the periphery of the camera’s range. While going in for a closer look, my heart sank when I saw a dozen or so individuals standing outside of some tents in the driveway.

I started to worry when I realized they were all armed with rifles. As I ordered the drone to return, I realized – the storm wasn’t over yet.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

11111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ashley had gone off to use the bathroom while I’d taken the drone out. When she walked back into the main room, she saw the worried look on my face and said, “Something’s wrong, isn’t it?”

I motioned Ashley over to the far corner of the room. Once we were out of Caleb’s earshot, I said, “There are dozen or so armed individuals in the yard, probably no more than 20 feet from the house.”

I saw all the color drain from Ashley’s face. “Did they see the drone?”

“I was no more than 10 feet from them; they’d have to have been blind not to see it.”

“Okay, so we have to assume they saw the drone.” Pacing around in a circle, one hand on her forehead, Ashley said, “Was there any damage to the house?”

I briefly wondered why Ashley was asking me that question; until I realized she wanted to know if those on the surface could reach the bunker. “The entire backside of the house, including the kitchen, was destroyed by a fallen tree.” Sighing, I said, “I don’t know if there’s a clear path; but if they’re determined enough, they can probably make it to the garage.”

“Even if they made it to the garage, there’s no chance they can get into the bunker.” Looking at me, Ashley said, “It would take a sizeable amount of explosives to breach the hatch.”

“So we’re safe down here, that’s what you’re saying?”

“They can’t do anything to harm us; all of the bunker’s life support systems are buried 10 feet under the back yard.” Pausing, thinking to herself, Ashley said, “The real question is, why camp out in my front yard? There’s got to be plenty of other better locations to hole up.”

Before I even had a chance to respond, I heard a crackling noise come over the bunker’s speaker system. “Thomas, I know you’re down there.”

Ashley’s face, as she looked at me, was one of pure dread. Looking at her, I said, “What’s going on? Who is that?”

“That would be Patrick, my step-father’s brother.”
11111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Enemy at the Gates

111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Before I could stop her, Ashley walked right passed me towards the weapons locker. She had already removed a shotgun and was in the process of loading it when I caught up with her. “Whoa!” grabbing the shotgun from her, I said, “You mind telling me what you’re doing?”

“That man is dangerous, Jamie; I won’t have him endangering you or Caleb.”

“I think we’re safe down here, Ash.” looking at her, I said, “As you said, nothing short of a bomb will get through that hatch.”

“You don’t understand, Jamie; Patrick is...relentless.” grabbing a pistol from the rack, Ashley said, “Once he sets his mind on something, he won’t stop until he’s got it.”

In all the years I’d known her, I’d never seen Ashley this upset about something; I was understandably worried. “What are you saying, Ash?”

Placing the pistol on the workbench, Ashley pointed in the direction of the hatch and said, “That man molested me!”

Now it was my turn for the color to drain from my face. “What?”

“Do you remember in 8th grade, when I wasn’t in school for a month?”

“Yeah, I vaguely remember that.” Looking at her, I said, “When you came back, you said you’d been out with mono.”

“I wish it had been mono.” Sighing, leaning against the bench for support, Ashley said, “It was Columbus Day weekend, we were at my step-grandparents house for a BBQ. I was playing with some of my cousins when Patrick asked if I could help get some stuff from the basement. I thought it was weird he didn’t ask one of the guys, but I went to help anyway. We got down there; and the next I know, I’m topless and he’s caressing my breasts.”

I was fuming at that point; to the point where I was almost willing to give Ashley back the shotgun. “What happened next?”

“I managed to knee him in the groin and run upstairs.” On the verge of tears, Ashley said, “I found my step-dad and one of my other uncles; after they called the cops, my step-dad went down to confront Patrick. By the time the cops got there, Patrick had a detached retina and a broken nose. Long story short, he was persona non grata after that.”

Ashley was on the verge of tears at that point, I dropped the shotgun and embraced her. After letting her cry into my shoulder for a moment, I looked at her and said, “You have my word, Ashley; I’ll never let that man anywhere near you.”

As if on cue, Patrick’s voice came over the speakers again. “I know you’re down there, Thomas; you better let me in.”

Ashley broke the hug and made her way down the hall to the intercom at the base of the ladder. I stood by, staying alert, while she pressed an intercom button. “You’re never getting in here, asshole.”
111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Ashley's Tragic Past

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
There was silence for a few seconds; until Patrick’s voice came over the intercom and said, “Ashley, is that you?”

“Yeah, it’s me.” Anger in her voice, Ashley said, “I’m not surprised you survived the end of the world; you always were a cockroach.”

“That’s no way to speak to family, young lady.”

Her face red with anger, Ashley said, “We stopped being family the day you molested me, asshole.”

“Is your father in there? I think I’d prefer to speak with him.”

“He’s in the bunker upstate with my mom.” Pausing, she said, “If you want to speak with him, go there; I doubt you’ll even make it past the guards.”

I was starting to worry about Ashley by that point; I’d never seen her get this angry before. That was until Patrick started speaking again. “So you’re all alone? Let me in, Ash; I’ll take real good care of you.”

Now it was my turn to get angry; so I gently pushed Ashley aside and pressed the intercom button. “She’s not alone down here, asshole.” Fuming, I said, “Now I suggest you get out of here while there’s still a chance I’ll miss your head.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ashley wrapped herself around me as I stared at the intercom; awaiting Patrick’s response. After a moment, he finally responded. “Who is this?”

“My name’s Jamie, and I’ll do everything within my power to keep Ashley safe.” Leaning closer to the intercom, I said, “That includes using the entire arsenal at my disposal to ensure you never get near her.”

“I don’t know what she’s told you, but you’ve got the wrong idea.” There was a brief pause before Patrick started again. “My group isn’t a threat to you; we just want to be let into the bunker.”

I glanced at Ashley, who was looking at me with a terrified expression, as she shook her head. It was apparent that she was still traumatized; all these years later, by what Patrick had done to her. Even the sound of his voice was enough to scare her.

Placing both my hands on her shoulders, I looked at Ashley and said, "You and Caleb are the two most important people in my life; I’ll die before I let anyone try to harm you.”

“What do you think you can do, Jamie?” looking at me, Ashley said, “He’s out there, and I’m sure as hell not going to let you go up there.”

Before I could respond, I heard Patrick’s voice come over the speaker again. I immediately figured something was wrong because his voice sounded off in the distance. “I told you guys not to worry, we’ll get into the bunker.” Pausing, he said, “I’ll be reunited with my niece, and then we’ll have plenty of meat to welcome her into the pack.”

All the color drained from our faces as Ashley and I looked at each other. Patrick and his group were the cannibals whose work we’d seen on the drone. Now I was certainly not going to let them into the bunker. While Ashley ran off somewhere to vomit, I pressed the intercom button and said, “Hey asshole, you had your finger on the button; we heard all of that.” Trying my best to keep from vomiting, I said, “There’s no way I’m letting a bunch of cannibals in here.”

“Well then, I guess we’ll have to do things the hard way.” Pausing, Patrick said, “Listen here Jamie, I promise you that we’ll get in there, and then I’ll make sure you’re the first course.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Situation Escalates

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I hoped that I was coming across as confident over the intercom, but I realized that Patrick did have a point. He didn’t seem very concerned about how he would get into the bunker; whereas I was concerned with the fact that I couldn’t do anything unless he got inside the bunker.

I stared at the intercom, desperately trying to think of something that I could do. Suddenly I had an idea, so I quickly ran across the bunker to the workshop and pulled up the drone’s maintenance system. I scrolled through the information until I found what I was looking for.

WEAPONS SYSTEM: OFFLINE

The hanger where the drone was kept was connected to the bunker through a dumbwaiter system with an airlock. While I waited for the drone to be brought down, I looked through the equipment until I found what I was looking for; a small-caliber pistol designed to attach to the drone.

After arming the drone, and sending it back up, I went back to the intercom; thinking to myself –Now let's see how you feel about threatening Ashley and Caleb, asshole.

With the controls in hand, I flew the drone to the front yard; where I saw Patrick and a group of men inside the garage. Piping myself through the drone, I said, “I’m giving you all one last chance; leave now and never come back.”

“I already told you, kid; I’m getting inside whether you like it or not.” Staring menacingly at the drone, Patrick said, “Let’s go boys; it’s supper time.”

Even within the confined space of the garage, I was able to line up a shot and take out one of the attackers. I quickly moved the drone out of the line of fire, before taking down another one. They knew I was serious by that point.”

“I’m still getting in, kid.” Reaching for the keypad, he said, “My brother set up an access code, and I’m positive I know what it is.”

I watched as he grabbed the outer hatch; before he stiffened and fell to the ground. Seeing his lifeless body, I thought to myself, You might have known your brother; but did you forget he didn't want you anywhere near his stepdaughter? I’d suspected there was a booby trap but had no way of knowing for sure until now.

Going back to the intercom, I said, “Leave the dead as a warning to others. If I ever see any of you again, I’ll shoot you on sight.”

With the leadership position suddenly vacant, and with three fewer mouths to feed, the surviving cannibals took my offer and beat a hasty retreat.

I waited a few moments, making sure they’d truly left, before bringing the drone back. Once it was secure in the hanger, I went looking for Ashley and found her in the sleeping area with Caleb. “It's all clear, they’re gone.”

Ashley wasn't at ease yet. "What about Patrick?"

“I promise you he’ll never trouble you again.” Watching as Ashley tucked Caleb into bed, I said, “How’s Caleb?”

“He heard everything Patrick said; I had to promise that we’d keep him safe. He was so shaken up, he called me Mommy by accident.” sighing, Ashley said, “Are you sure they’re gone?”

“I’m positive; it’s over, Ash.”

“I want to believe you, Jamie; but you don’t know Patrick the way I do.” Shaking, Ashley said, “He’s relentless; he won’t give up as long there’s breath in his body.”

Taking Ashley’s hand, I led her into the main room; I punched up some photos from the drone to show her. “Take a look."

"Is... is he... ?"

"Dead? He punched in a code he thought would work; I guess your step-dad had a builtin booby trap. He took enough amps to kill him instantly; your stepdad was looking out for you."

Ashley held me while she absorbed this; then she kissed me. Then she kissed me again, harder. I returned the kiss and she then began pulling at my clothes. Soon enough we were on the couch having sex.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Decisive Action

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The two of us made passionate love for almost an hour until we stopped. We were currently lying together on the couch; Ashley dozing next to me. I lay there, watching her sleep, while I tried to process what just happened.

Most of the guys in my class, including myself, thought that Ashley was incredibly attractive. There wasn’t one among them that would give their eye teeth for a chance to sleep with her. The irony was that it took the end of the world for me to have a chance with her.

I gingerly ran my hand down her side; which caused her to stir. Turning to look at me, she smiled and said, “Hey you.”

“Hey.”

Leaning over, Ashley kissed me and said, “That was incredible.”

The two of us kissed for a moment, until I said, “Forgive me for asking; but...what made you decide to do this?”

“I guess I was just hungry for human contact; plus I needed to let off some steam after seeing Patrick again.”

For a brief moment, I wondered if I’d just been a convenient screw for Ashley to let off some steam. But then I thought back to the lovemaking, and there was no way that was the case. “If you ever need to let off some more steam, you know where to find me.”

With a grin, Ashley said, “Now that you mention it, I think I still have some steam to let off.”

That was all I needed to hear; as I leaned over and kissed her again. As the two of us resumed lovemaking, I was relieved that the door to the sleeping area was soundproof.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Talking

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Day 95

Two things became abundantly clear as the days turned into weeks: there was something between us, and Ashley didn't just need to let off steam.

The first part was fairly obvious based on how we acted around each other; whenever we were working in close quarters, our hands had a knack for finding each other. It was almost as if we were always reaching for the same thing at the same time. Once our hands touched, we’d turn and smile at each other. Even when we weren't working together, we'd find a reason to watch the other person work, and that would make us smile.

What proved the second part was, now and then, Ash would get this look in her eye. Whenever she got that look, we’d put Caleb to bed for the night; then she’d pull me to the couch where we’d make love.

It was my 19th birthday when it finally happened. First, during breakfast, Ashley kissed me and said, “Happy birthday, Jamie.”

We’d been careful about how we acted around Caleb, but it was inevitable that he’d see us kiss now and then. At first, he thought it was gross, now it barely fazed him. Looking up from his cereal, he said, “It’s your birthday, Jamie? I never heard you ask for nothing."

“There’s no reason to anymore, Caleb; all we’d get is things we already have.” Smiling, I said, “So instead we’re celebrating the most important thing; that we have each other. "

Ashley baked me a cake that night, and it tasted much better than the one I’d made for her. After that, we watched a movie, nothing too raunchy since Caleb was watching too. Throughout the movie, Ashley was giving me The Look.

Once the movie was over, we tucked Caleb in for the night, then went to the couch and made love.

*****************************


After we’d finished, Ashley and I snuggled together on the couch. Looking at me, with a look of pure happiness, she said, “I love you, Jamie."

Running a hand down her waist, I said, “I love you, too.”

“Do you want to know a secret? Something that I've never told anybody before?"

“Sure, why not?”

“I’ve been in love with you since high school.” Looking at me, she said, “Seriously, I would dream about you every night."

I was shocked; the most attractive girl in school had been in love with me. “Why did you never say anything?"

“I told my mom a few years ago that I thought you were cute, but she just laughed and said you weren’t good enough for me.” Sighing, Ashley said, “It was the way she said it that got to me: like you and I were barely the same species, and I'd lose everything if I tried anything with you."

"So why now?" I asked.

"You mean aside from the fact that the world is destroyed and everything is pretty much gone already? You’ll probably hate me for saying this, but it took the world ending for me to realize there’s more to life than social strata." She looked me straight in the eye. "Like being with the man you love."

"Since we’re sharing secrets, I’ve got one for you.” Looking at her, I said, “I’ve been in love with you since high school too. But my friends all said you were out of my league, and my mom didn’t like what your mom was saying about me. It took the end of the world to get through to me, too."

“God, how could we have been so stupid?”

“None of that matters anymore.” Leaning over, I kissed Ashley and said, “All that matters now is that we’re together at last.”
We popped in one of my favorite movies, A Fish Called Wanda. Then, we made love again.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: My Birthday

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Against Ashley’s protests, I decided to venture up to the surface for a brief excursion. As soon as I climbed out of the hatch, I noticed just how much damage the cannibals had caused to the garage in their attempt to enter the bunker.

They’d torn down one of the garage doors and pretty much destroyed the remaining car in the garage. I’d seen it through the drone, but seeing it in person was different.

I also noticed the three bodies lying on the ground. I stared at them for a brief moment before I decided to relocate them to the side of the house. It took some doing but I managed to do it. I was in the process of moving Patrick’s body when Ashley’s voice came over the earpiece. “How’s it looking up there, Jamie?”

“It’s not that bad, actually; the snow has covered pretty much the entire area.” Looking around the yard, I said, “If you don’t think about what caused it, the view is almost serene.”

“Don’t stay up there too long, alright?” pausing, Ashley said, “Just find out if the cannibals left any supplies behind that we can use.”

“Yes, dear.” With a sarcastic tone, I said, “Is there anything else you’d like me to do?”

“Well, now that you mention it; could you clean the gutters and mow the lawn?”

As I started towards the cannibal’s abandoned camp, I said, “I’ll see what I can do.”

**********************


The cannibals must’ve fled in a hurry because they left everything behind. As I picked through everything, I sardonically prayed that they were dead. If anyone deserves to die, it’s them. I’d already rolled up two tents that were in the best condition; along with some sleeping bags and some canned goods.

I found a cooler near where they had their fire; I went to open it and immediately regretted it. I had to take my helmet off to vomit at the sight of several severed limbs. I decided then and there to relocate the cooler away from here. Once that was finished, I grabbed the supplies and started heading back towards the house.

As I approached the house, I looked to the east and smiled; seeing the faintest glimmer of the sun trying to peek through the ash layer.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Surface Excursion (Day 100)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I suppose it was only a matter of time before it happened; I just wish Ashley and I figured out how we’d handle it when it did. It was early in the afternoon and we’d just lay Caleb down for his afternoon nap.

I was in the workshop effecting repairs to the vacuum cleaner when Ashley walked into the room. “Hey, you busy?”

“Not really.” Looking up from the vacuum, I said, “Why?”

“Oh, no reason.” With a coy smile, Ashley said, “I was just thinking perhaps we could let off some steam.”

I quickly realized where Ashley was going with this. Putting the wire cutters down, I looked at her and said, “What about Caleb? He’s going to wake up in a little while.”

“I don’t think so; he wore himself out chasing after an escaped chicken this morning.” Stepping into the room, Ashley said, “I think we’ll be fine.”

In hindsight, I probably should have declined, but I didn’t want to pass up a chance for sex. “Okay then, let’s go to it then.”

***********************


So that’s how we found ourselves in our current situation. We’d just finished our first lovemaking session, so the two of us were snuggling on the couch. As the two of us lay there, I looked at Ashley and said, “Can I ask you a question?”

“Sure.” Turning to look at me, Ashley said, “What’s on your mind?”

“If the world hadn’t ended; do you think there’s a chance we might’ve ended up together?”

“Once we went off to college, and we got away from our families, maybe we could have found a way.” turning serious, Ashley said, “What made you think of that?”

“No reason, I was just thinking about how we both had feelings for each other in high school.” Pausing, I said, “Perhaps Samson was the universe’s way of getting us together.”

Ashley was about to say something when we were suddenly interrupted by the sound of an opening door. My heart skipped a beat as we both turned to find Caleb staring at us. Mortified, I looked down at Ashley as she said, “Oh crap.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Inevitable (Day 110)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ashley and I could only stare at Caleb; frozen like deer in a headlight. After a moment, Caleb asked, “Whatcha doing?”

I wish I could say we had an answer ready for him, but we didn’t. I’m embarrassed to admit we thought the chances of this happening were non-existent. All we could do was hem and haw while lying completely naked on the couch. Suddenly Caleb took a step towards us, “Can I...”

Coming to our senses, before Caleb got too close, we both shouted, “NO!”

Caleb then took a few steps back; unsure if he’d said or done something wrong. It was at that moment I thought of something to say. “We’re doing something special, and private, that only adults can do.”

“Oh.” Pausing, Caleb said, “So I can’t do it?”

Looking at Caleb, trying to sound diplomatic, Ashley said, “Not until you’re older, champ.”

I was started to get annoyed by the interruption, so I said, “If you give us some privacy, Caleb, I’ll explain it to you later.”

“Okay.” his big questions answered, he started to turn around. He quickly stopped and turned back. “When’s dinner?”

“Soon, champ.” Smiling, Ashley said, “How do burgers for dinner sound?’

“Yay!”

Once Caleb went back into the sleeping area and closed the door, Ashley looked at me and said, “We’re going to need someplace more private.” Sighing, Ashley said, “I’d rather not have to tell Caleb’s parents, if we ever see them again, that he walked in on us having sex.”

******************************


As I’d promised, I sat down with Caleb before he went to bed and answered his questions. The kid was quite smart for his age; he understood that he’d walked in on grownup stuff, and had surprised his parents on more than one occasion.

After hearing that they just shooed him away, I started to wonder if Ashley and I made the wrong decision by answering his questions. We were still new to the whole parenting thing, and it wasn’t like we could ask anyone for pointers.

Once Caleb was down for the night, Ashley and I went looking for a more private spot for lovemaking than the couch. Not that we would be trying it out right away.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Some Awkwardness

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ashley and I knew there wasn’t a whole lot we could do, but we also knew we had to make today extra special for Caleb. After all, it was his 5th birthday. I’ll admit to feeling bad for him, he was at the age where he was supposed to be starting kindergarten; instead, he was holed up in an underground bunker for the next 3 years.

I couldn’t help but wonder what kind of life he’ll have once we’re back on the surface. What were the chances he’d have a normal life; or that anyone would have a normal life.

*******************************


We told Caleb to play in the sleeping area while Ashley and I set about redecorating the main area for his birthday. I was hanging makeshift streamers from the ceiling while Ashley was busy working on baking a cake.

Now and then I would catch her looking at me; a strange look in her eyes. In fact, over the last few days, I’d noticed her acting somewhat differently around me. After hanging up the last of the streamers, I walked over to the kitchen. Coming up behind her, I wrapped my arms around her and said, “Have I told you lately how amazing you are?”

“I think you’ve said it a few times.” Turning around, Ashley said, “But once more wouldn’t hurt.”

“Well then, here goes.” Kissing her, I said, “You are the most amazing woman I’ve ever met.”

“Thank you.” Kissing me back, Ashley said, “You are the most amazing man I’ve ever met.”

“Come on now, you’re just saying that because I’m your boyfriend.”

“That’s certainly a part of it, but I’ve always thought you were amazing.” Her mood turning sullen, Ashley said, “As long as we’re together, I know everything will be alright.”

Reading between the lines, I couldn’t help but wonder if there was something on Ashley’s mind. Looking at her, I said, “Hey is there something you’re not telling me?”

Turning back to the cake, Ashley said, “I’ll tell you later, after Caleb’s party.”

*******************************


Even though we couldn’t give him presents, Ashley and I made sure Caleb had an enjoyable birthday. He loved the cake and the party games; so much so that he must’ve hugged each of us a dozen times. As one would expect with all the sugar he’d had, Caleb eventually tired himself out.

After putting him down for a nap, I walked back into the main room; where Ashley was taking the streamers down from the wall. Looking at me, she said, “I think Caleb enjoyed the party, don’t you think?”

“I think I bruised a few ribs from all his hugs; but yeah I think he enjoyed it.” Pausing, I said, “Is now a good time for us to talk?”

I saw Ashley hesitate for a moment; clearly whatever she wanted to talk about had her worried. Stepping down from the stool, she walked over to me. “There’s no easy way for me to say this, so I’ll just come right out with it.” Taking a deep breath, Ashley said, “I’m late.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Special Day (Day 120)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
“You’re late?” I’ll admit it; I almost had to ask what she was late for. Looking at her, I said, “Are you sure? How late are you?”

“I’m about a week late at this point.” Sighing, clearly nervous, Ashley said, “I haven’t been this late since before Samson hit.”

“Is there any way for us to know for sure?” looking at her, I said, “There’s no sense in making plans until we know for sure.”

“Honestly, I don’t know.” Pacing, Ashley said, “I wasn’t paying all that much attention when they were stocking this place.”

Ashley and I spent some time checking through the medical supplies. The good news was that we did have pregnancy tests. The bad news; the boxes recommended taking them first thing in the morning.

Day 121:

Neither of us slept very soundly that night; we were both understandably terrified. How could we possibly raise two children in a bunker? What kind of life would they have down here? What if they never felt the sun on their faces or the smell in the air after it rained?

We both got up at the crack of dawn, or rather when the lights turned on. After making sure that Caleb was still asleep, Ashley went to take the test while I paced around the main area. The five minutes we had to wait seemed like an eternity, but eventually, it was ready and Ashley went to check.

When she came back in, holding the test, I looked at her and said, “What does it say?”

“I’m not pregnant.”

I’ll be the first to admit I was a little relieved. But, looking at Ashley, I could tell she felt differently. “Are you alright?”

“I don’t know; I mean, I should be relieved, but I’m a little disappointed.” Sitting next to me, Ashley said, “I wasn’t exactly thrilled at the prospect, but I did like the idea of having your baby."

"I feel the same way," I said. "But it's probably a better idea to wait until we know we're ready."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ever since Ashley and I became physical, we’d been hard-pressed to find some privacy. That became even more important after Caleb walked in on us having sex. With that in mind, I’d spent the better part of the last few days relocating some things from the smaller storage room into the larger one. The idea was to turn that into a bedroom for Caleb, while Ashley and I took the sleeping area.

To that end, I was suiting up to venture up to the surface; in the hopes of scavenging some things from Ashley’s bedroom. Once I was secure inside the suit, I made my way to the ladder where I found Ashley waiting for me. “I probably sound like a broken record, but promise you’ll be careful up there.”

“I will; I promise.” Chuckling, I said, “I’ll be on Channel 3 if you want to chat.”

***********************


I’d been on the surface for about 25 minutes, putting what I could salvage into some boxes I’d brought with me. I’d been primarily focusing on the stuffed animals that Ashley had in her room, but I also rummaged through a box of children’s books in her closet.

I was in the middle of closing up one of the boxes when I heard a noise in the hallway. I’d seen some animal footprints on the ground the last few times I’d taken the drone out, so I knew there was some surviving wildlife in the area. I was more than a little worried that there might be an animal in the house.

As the sound grew closer, I was grateful that I’d brought a handgun with me. Removing it from the holster, I aimed it towards the door as I noticed a faint shadow moving on the floor. In the hopes of scaring off whatever was out there, I fired off a quick shot. This was quickly followed by the sound of Ashley frantically saying, “Don’t shoot! It’s me!”

I lowered the gun as Ashley, wearing an environmental suit of her own, appeared in the doorway. Looking at her, I said, “I could have shot you! What the hell are you doing up here?”

“I’ve been cooped up underground for 4 months; forgive me for wanting to come up for some air.”

“You left Caleb down there alone?” shocked, I said, “Are you crazy?”

“Give me some credit, Jamie.” Even with the helmet on, I could tell she was annoyed. “I closed the hatch after I came up; besides, he’s so focused on his movies that he’ll barely realize we’re gone.”

“Okay, fine.” Getting back to work, I said, “I just wish you would’ve told me you were planning this.”

“Fair enough, I’ll do better next time.” Going to look out her window, overlooking what was once a spacious backyard, Ashley said, “It’s hard to remember what all this used to look like.”

“If we’re having difficulty picturing what the world used to look like, can you…”

My sentence was cut off when, in the process of retrieving something from the closet, I stumped back into a bookshelf. Before I knew what was happening, it fell over and pinned my right leg underneath it.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Surface Excursion (Day 130)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ashley was at my side immediately; dropping to her knees, she said, “Are you alright?”

”Oh yeah, I’m fine.” Trying to work through the pain, I said, “On the bright side, I’m pretty sure it’s not broken.”

“Do you think you can move it?”

“Sure, if it was on your leg.” Groaning, I said, “But I wouldn’t have a chance under these circumstances.”

Getting to her feet, Ashley said, “Well then, I guess it's up to me to save you.”

***************************


For 20 minutes Ashley tried her best; but despite her best efforts, she couldn’t lift the shelf. Whoever made this bookcase did so too well; after all, it survived Samson with barely a scratch. The situation grew direr as time went by; I was running out of air. “Listen, Ash, I’ve only got 15 minutes of air left.” Groaning, I said, “Just get the stuff down to the bunker and...”

“Don’t you dare finish that sentence, Jamie Lincoln!” looking at me, getting emotional, Ashley said, “It took the world ending for us to finally be together, I’m not going to lose you now.”

Before I could protest, she grabbed the bookcase one last time. I don’t know if it was adrenaline or what, but she lifted the shelf off my leg just enough for me to move. It took some doing but we managed to get everything down into the bunker.

I had to carefully lower myself down the ladder; but, once I was down, Ashley followed suit. I took a look at my leg after Ashley carried me to the couch; as I’d suspected, it was just severely sprained. “I suppose it could have been worse.”

“You’re off your feet until your leg is better; I don’t want to hear any arguments.” Grabbing one of the boxes, Ashley said, “I’m going to start cleaning this stuff for Caleb.”

I certainly wasn’t going to argue with her. In fact, while she went off to clean the box of goods, I sat there thinking. If we still had an outside world, I would ask her to marry me.

I watched as Caleb came over and climbed onto the couch with me. As he snuggled against me, I realized something. There wasn’t anything preventing me from marrying her. After all, all I need is a ring.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Trouble on the Surface

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I’d learned quite a lot of over the last four months; one of the most important lessons being just how resourceful Ashley was. This was exemplified by the fact that, for the last few days, I’d been moving around the bunker on a pair of crutches that she’d fabricated from items lying around.

Caleb was thrilled to have a room of his own once again; even if it was filled with, as he said, girl stuff. He may have complained a little bit, but I saw how much fun he was having with some of Ashley’s old stuffed animals.

Ashley and I were enjoying the fact that we had a room to ourselves now; even if my leg injury had put a damper on our lovemaking.
But that’s okay; I was more than happy to snuggle with her in bed.

I hadn’t forgotten about my decision, I was going to ask her to marry me. It didn’t matter that it wouldn’t be a legal wedding, so long as we considered ourselves to be husband and wife.

To that end, I’d been working on fabricating a rudimentary ring from some of the spare parts in the workshop. It wasn’t the most
fashionable, but it was the best I could do under the circumstances.

I roped Caleb into helping as well; after making him swear that he’d keep it a secret. Now I just had to wait for my leg to heal; because I wanted to this right, which meant I would have to get down on one knee.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Recovering and Planning (Day 135)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It took me a while to heal up, what with no doctor available. But I did everything I could to help the process along. Luckily, the medical library had a book of therapeutic exercises, some of which helped.

When Halloween came around, Caleb missed going trick-or-treating. But we did find some movies that weren't too spooky for a 5-year-old. Once he was in bed, Ashley and I watched Halloween.

As my leg recovered, I built a makeshift cane, to replace my makeshift crutches.

We had a few turkeys in addition to the chickens, so Thanksgiving was somewhat traditional.

Finally, it was Christmas. My leg was healed, the ring had been polished and smoothed, and Caleb knew his line.

After a day of Christmas DVDs, and singing a few Christmas carols, Caleb asked, "What would you two ask for, if you could?"

"Gee, honey, I have no idea," Ashley said. "With you and Jamie, I've got everything I could possibly want."

"Well, I guess there's just one thing I could ask for," I said.

Before Ashley could say anything, I got down on my knee to her and took out the ring I'd made. "I know there's no way we can make this official, but hearing the words will be enough for me: Ashley Saunders, will you agree to be my wife?"

Ashley didn't say anything right away. I wasn't sure what to do.

Finally, she said, "Be your wife? Jamie, as far as I'm concerned, I am your wife." Then she kissed me.

Then Caleb hugged us both, and we hugged him.

That night, once Caleb was asleep, Ashley and I put on a Yule log DVD in our bedroom, so we could pretend to make love in front of the fireplace.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Merry Christmas (Day 230)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I woke up around 7:30, a little while after the lights came on, to find Ashley just staring at me in me. With a smile, she said, “I could watch you sleep all day, and I’d never get tired of it.”

“I could do the same.” Smiling, I said, “Do you ever find yourself thinking this is all too good to be true?”

“Only once have I felt that way, and that was only after we slept together the first time.”

Ashley slowly inched herself closer to me; I went to kiss her, only to stop when I heard noises from out in the kitchen. Pulling back, I said, “It sounds like Caleb is up; perhaps we should get out of bed.”

“Oh alright, if you say so.” Getting out of bed, Ashley said, “Before I forget, Happy New Year.”

“It seems weird to celebrate that holiday, considering the state of the world right now.” Sitting up in bed, I said, “We have no way of knowing how many people died when Samson struck; it just seems pointless to celebrate a holiday of renewal..”

Getting a fresh shirt from her drawer, Ashley said, “Instead of marking the holiday, why don’t we just take a day off.” Looking at me, Ashley said, “We’ve been working pretty much non-stop for the last few weeks; I think we all deserve a day to relax.”

“I’m not going to argue with that.” Reaching for my cane, I said, “I’ll make some popcorn, and then the three of us could have a movie marathon.”

After I got dressed, the two of us walked out into the main room; walking into find Caleb sitting at the counter with a bowl of cereal. While I went to get some popcorn from the pantry, I watched as Ashley went over and kissed Caleb on the head. “Good morning kiddo.”

In an uncharacteristically reserved tone, without looking up from his cereal, Caleb said, “Morning.”

Turning around, I walked over to the counter and said, “You look like you've got something on your mind, little buddy," I said. “What's up?"

Putting his spoon down, Caleb looked at us and said, “You’re going to think it’s silly.”

“I promise you we won’t, kiddo.” Glancing at me, Ashley said, “You know you can tell us anything.”

“Okay.” Sighing, Caleb looked at the two of us and said, “Will you be my mommy and daddy?"
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Start of a New Year (Day 237)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ashley and I looked at each other in shock. Turning my attention back to Caleb, I said, “What brought this on?” pausing, I said, “We’ve been Ashley and Jamie to you since you got here”

“I know that.” Sighing, Caleb said, “I just thought they’d come back for me.”

“Honey, we’ve been over that.” Placing a hand on Caleb’s shoulder, Ashley said, “The surface is no place for a child right now.”

“But I thought they’d come back for me once they found someplace safe.” Starting to tear up, Caleb said, “What if they can’t come back because they’re...they’re…”

I quickly wrapped my arms around him as Caleb started crying; with Ashley rubbing his back. Once he calmed down, I looked at him and said, “So you want us to keep looking after you; only we’d do so as your parents?”

Caleb nodded silently. “I think we can do that; after all, Jamie and I don’t need a piece of paper to tell us that we’re married.”
Looking at Caleb, Ashley said, “I don’t see why you need a piece of paper to tell you who your parents are. So if you want me to be your mother, Caleb, then I would be honored.”

“Same here…son.” Smiling, I said, “I’d be honored to be your father.”

The three of us hugged after that. After a moment, Ashley said, “Now we’ve got something to celebrate.” Smiling, she said, “A year ago we were three different people from three different families. Now we’re all one big happy family.”

******************************


I had a strange dream that night; that I was having a cookout with both my families, the one I’d grown up with and the one I’d made in the bunker. We were all having a great time together; until I woke up and remembered that they were dead.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: We Are Family

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Today was a solemn day for me; as it would have been my parent’s 21st anniversary. What bummed me out, even more than the fact they were dead, was that I was starting to forget what they all sounded like. Sure I had videos saved on my laptop that I could watch, but it wasn’t the same as hearing their voices in person.

I was taking a spin on the treadmill when Ashley came over to me with a bottle of water in her hands. Handing me the water bottle, she said, “I can’t say that I understand what you’re going through, but I’m here if you want to talk.”

Unscrewing the cap, I looked at her and said, “I’m not sure talking about it would make me feel any better.” Taking a sip, I said, “It will just remind me that they’ll never meet their daughter-in-law or their grandson.”

“I have a feeling they’ll be more excited about Caleb than they would be about me.” Looking at me, a sullen look on her face, Ashley said, “Don’t forget that your parents didn’t think very highly of me, and I certainly wasn’t on Emma’s good side.”

“You aren’t giving yourself enough credit, Ash; you’ve come a long way from that selfish, cocky girl I knew in High School.”

Flashing an angry look at me, Ashley said, “There better be a compliment in there.”

“What I’m saying is you’ve grown over the last seven months.” Wrapping an around her, I said, “I think my family would come around to you.”

“I owe all of that to you, Jamie; I certainly wouldn’t be here if hadn’t been for you.” Leaning against me, Ashley said, “You make me want to be a better person; both for you and our son.”

It had only been a week since Caleb asked us to be his parents, and I still found it hard to believe. I was only 18 years old, and I already had a wife and a 5-year-old son.

Looking around the room, I realized Caleb was nowhere to be seen. “Speaking of Caleb, where is he? He wanted me to teach him about the hydroponic garden.”

“He thought it would be a fun idea to have breakfast in bed.” Sighing, Ashley said, “Long story short, he’s putting his syrup-stained sheets in the wash.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Family Matters (Day 244)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was a pretty quiet day in the bunker; I was tinkering in the workshop, Ashley was taking a run on the treadmill, and Caleb was watching a movie. It was just one of those days where none of us wanted to do anything.

I had just finished cleaning one of the handguns when I realized that I’d used up the last of the cleaner. Walking over to the cabinet, which was next to the chicken coop, I was about to grab another can of cleaner when I noticed something out of the corner of my eye.

Looking towards the coop, I realized what had caught my attention – one of the hens was lying in the corner. Upon closer inspection, I realized that she was dead. Early on Ashley and I had come up with a plan if this were to happen; I would take the deceased chicken and bury it a short distance from the house. It was something I had to do twice before Caleb joined us, but this would be the first time I’d have to do it since he got here.

Now Caleb was a smart kid for his age, but I didn’t know how much experience he had with death. If it was a new experience for him, Ashley and I would have to broach the subject carefully. Walking over to the door, I yelled over to Ashley, “Hey babe, can you come in here for a moment?”

Ashley got off the treadmill and walked over to me. As I gently pulled her into the room and closed the door, she said, “What’s up?”

“We have a little situation here.” Pointing towards the coop, I said, “One of the hens died.”

“So? Just bring it up to the surface and bury it as we discussed.” Confused, Ashley said, “I don’t see what…Oh, now I see the problem.”

Glad that we were on the same page, I said, “What are we going to do?” sighing, I said, “Caleb’s going to want to know why I’m going to the surface.”

“I don’t know.” Leaning against the wall, Ashley said, “If we tell him, we’ll have to do it gently.”

“Doesn’t that seem at all weird to you?” looking at her, I said, “He survived a disaster that killed untold millions of people, and we have to tiptoe around the idea of a dead chicken.”

“I understand that, but don’t forget he’s still just a kid.” Pausing, Ashley said, “We have no idea what kind of exposure he had to something like this.”

“Well we have to do something, pretty soon that body is going to start to smell.”

Ashley walked around in a tight circle for a moment; before stopping and looking at me. “Okay, we’ll just tell him that the chicken was sick.” Holding her chin in her hand, Ashley said, “If he asks questions then we’ll answer them; otherwise we’ll just leave it at that.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue (Day 260)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
While Ashley went to get Caleb, I stepped back into the coop and gently lifted the deceased chicken out. I was in the process of laying it atop a garbage bag when Ashley and Caleb walked into the room. Almost immediately Caleb noticed what I was doing and said, “Daddy, what are you doing with Marshmallow?”

Against my better judgment, a few months back, I had agreed to let Caleb name the chickens. I didn’t want him getting too attached to them, particularly in events such as this. “I’m afraid Marshmallow is dead, Caleb.” Sighing, I said, “She must’ve been sick for a while.”

“Is she going to be alright?”

Despite having enough understanding to believe that his parents were dead, it seemed as though Caleb didn’t truly have a grasp on the concept. I exchanged a glance with Ashley, before saying, “I’m sorry Caleb, but Marshmallow isn’t going to get better.”

The gravity of the situation slowly dawned on Caleb; as he started tearing up. Getting on her knees, Ashley pulled him in for a hug as he started to cry. “It’ll be alright, sweetie; Marshmallow had a good long life.” Rubbing his back, Ashley said, “Your dad has to go up to the surface to bury her.”

“Does he have to?”

“I’m afraid so, buddy.” Turning away from Marshmallow’s body, I said, “If I don’t bury her, then the bunker will start to smell pretty bad.”

******************


Caleb insisted that we have a quick funeral for Marshmallow; once that was finished I put her in the garbage bag and headed for the surface. I walked to a point about a ¼ mile from the bunker; in an area just above a small creek.

I had some difficulty digging a deep enough hole, but after 45 minutes of trying, I managed to dig one. After placing the bag in the hole, I filled it back in. I was about to head back to the bunker when something caught my eye.

Looking towards a nearby tree, I saw a faint glint of light reflecting off something. Moving closer to inspect it, I saw that it was a small picture frame half-buried in the snow. Digging out of the snow, my jaw dropped when I saw what it was a picture of – Caleb and his parents.

The frame was cracked in several places but the photo was in decent condition. Looking around the area, I figured they must’ve sent up camp in the area.

With the frame in hand, I started back to the bunker; calling Ashley on the radio, “Hey Ash, I’m on my way back; I think I found something that will make Caleb feel better about Marshmallow.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Talking to Caleb

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I found Ashley waiting for me as I climbed back into the bunker. Looking at her, I said, “Where’s Caleb? I think he’ll want to see this.”

“I think he’s in his room.” grabbing my shoulder, Ashley said, “Did you really find a family photo out there?”

Taking the frame out from my pocket, I handed it to her and said, “I found it half-buried in snow about a ¼ mile from here; I have a feeling they may have camped there at some point.”

“I’m surprised that the photo is in such good condition; you would think it would have disintegrated from the moisture months ago.” Looking at me, holding the frame in her hands, Ashley said, “This is going to mean the world to Caleb; it will give him something to remember his parents.”

“I wonder if I should go back up there at some point; search around the area and see what else I can find.”

“We’ll discuss that later.” Handing the photo back to me, Ashley said: “For now, I think you should give this to Caleb.”

I nodded silently and made my way down the hall to Caleb’s bedroom. Knocking on the door, I said, “Caleb it’s dad. Can I come in?”

There was a moment of silence before the door opened; Caleb was standing there and it looked like he’d been crying. “Did you bury Marshmallow?”

“Yeah kiddo, I buried her by the creek.” Kneeling, I said, “While I was out there, I found something I think you’ll want to see.”

“Really?” wiping his eyes, Caleb said, “What is it?”

“I found this buried in the snow by the creek.” Turning the frame towards Caleb, I said, “I thought you might want to have it.”

Caleb stared at the photo for a second; before he took it from me and started crying. Ashley and I watched as he alternated between looking at it and holding it to his chest. After a few minutes of this, he gently placed the frame on his dresser and turned his attention back to us. Hugging me, he said, “Thank you, daddy.”

“You’re welcome, little man.” Rubbing Caleb’s back, I said, “Now you have something to remember your parents by.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Returning to the Bunker

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ashley and I have spent the last 9 months cut off from the outside world; save for our interactions with Caleb’s parents and the cannibals. That’s a long time to only have two other people you can talk to. We made it work; but it wasn’t without its difficulties, especially during Ashley’s time of the month.

Ever since Ashley and I moved into the bunker, we’d had a ham radio turned on; scanning every frequency for signs of outside contact. For 9 months we’d heard nothing but static – but that was soon going to change.

****************************


I’d been having trouble sleeping for almost a week, so it wasn’t surprising when I woke up at 6:30 in the morning. Seeing that Ashley was still asleep, I gently kissed her on the forehead and climbed out of bed. I then proceeded to check on Caleb, as I’d done every day for the last week.

Having just checked on Caleb, I walked through the living area to get something to eat. I spotted in my tracks when I noticed a blinking light coming from the ham radio. I had to pinch myself to make sure I wasn’t dreaming; as a blinking light meant the radio had found an active frequency.

I tripped over some of Caleb’s toys as I ran across to the radio. I turned up the volume as I put on the headset, catching the tail end of a transmission:

“...unker on a frequency of 51.53Mhz. Is anyone receiving me on this frequency?”

As I scrambled for the microphone I hoped they were still listening. “He-Hello? This is Jamie Lincoln, can you hear me?”

I feared the worst when all I heard for a moment was static. After a moment a woman’s voice came over the headset. “Jamie Lincoln, this is Corporal Elena Reyes transmitting from the Appalachian Bunker.”

Hearing that made my heart skip a beat; the Appalachian Bunker was where I would’ve been evacuated to. After composing myself, I said, “D-Did you say the Appalachian Bunker?”

“That’s correct” there was a brief pause, before Corporal Reyes said, “Where are you transmitting from?”

I must’ve been making too much noise because suddenly Ashley was standing in the doorway with an annoyed look on her face. “What the hell are you doing? It’s 6:45 in the morning.”

Putting the microphone down, I said, “The radio picked up a signal; it’s the Appalachian Bunker.”

“What?” her annoyed look turned to shock, Ashley said, “A-Are you sure?”

I unplugged the headset just as Corporal Reyes started speaking again. “Jamie Lincoln, are you still there?”

While Ashley stood there, stunned, I picked up the microphone and said, “Yes, I’m here. I’m transmitting from a bunker in Granby, West Virginia.” Catching my breath, I said, “I’ve with my wife and our 5-year-old son.”

Corporal Reyes took down all our information; including how we were left behind during the evacuation. After a few minutes, she came back over the radio and said, “Jamie, we’ve been able to locate your wife’s family; they’re alive and well.”

I watched as Ashley started to tear up. Reaching for the microphone, she said, “C-Can I talk with them?”

“Of course, ma’am; we’ve already sent for them.” Pausing, Corporal Reyes said, “Jamie, sir, we...”

I knew what she was going to say; they weren’t able to find my family. “You won’t find them, Corporal Reyes, because my family is dead. They were in the destroyed bus.”

It was my turn to tear up at this point. Don’t get me wrong, I was thrilled that Ashley was going to speak with her family. I just wish that I had that chance as well. So you can imagine how I reacted when Corporal Reyes came back on and said, “You don’t understand, Jamie; your family is alive. We’ve sent for them as well.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Contact with the Outside World (Day 290)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I couldn’t believe it; after so many months of thinking that they were dead. “Th-They’re alive? Are you sure?”

“We’re sure, Jamie.” Corporal Reyes replied. “Believe me, they were just as surprised to hear that you were alive.”

While I tried to process this new information, I turned to Ashley and said, “Go get Caleb; I want him to speak with his grandparents.”

It seemed that Ashley didn’t need much persuading, as she was on the move before I’d even finished. They returned a moment later, with Caleb rubbing the sleep from his eyes, as a familiar voice came over the speakers. “Jamie?”

“M-Mom?” suddenly overwhelmed, I said, “Is it you?”

“It’s me, sweetheart; your father and sister are on their way as well.”

I started to choke up at that point; with Ashley gently rubbing my back. “I-I thought you were dead. When I saw the last bus...”

“They switched us with another family after you ran off to find that Saunders girl.” there was a brief pause before Mom continued. “They said you had a wife and son; how is that possible?”

“Being cooped up in a bunker together, our feelings for each other took over; we’ve been unofficially married since just before Christmas.” Smiling, between tears, I said, “Caleb’s a young boy that we adopted.”

“Well I’m glad to hear that you’re all safe; it’s very dangerous out there.”

“You don’t need to tell us, Mom.” Thinking back on everything we’ve been through, I said, “We’ve had our fair share of problems to overcome.”

There was a brief moment where all I heard was static; which made me worry that the connection was gone. That was until Mom said, “Your father and sister are here. We’d love to know who the lucky woman is.”

Knowing how my mom felt about Ashley, I was hesitant to say anything. But then I realized it wouldn’t be fair to keep it from them. “It’s Ashley, Mom.”

“Ashley?” with a shocked tone, Mom said, “You marred that awful girl?”

If Ashley was at all hurt by what my mom said, she didn’t show it. Instead, she showed the same restraint that she’s developed over the last few months. “I had that coming, Mrs. Lincoln; but I assure you that I’m improving.” Stepping closer to the transmitter, Ashley said, “Your son risked everything to save me, and I’ve spent every day for 9 months making sure I’m worthy of him. You should be very proud of him, ma’am; you and your husband did an excellent job raising him.”

Before anyone had a chance to respond to that, Caleb stepped forward and said, “Are you my gramma?”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Alive!

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
There was silence for a moment before anyone said anything. After a moment, Mom said, “I guess I am, sweetheart. It’s very nice to meet you.”

“Where are you?”

“I’m in another bunker a long distance away; with about 3000 other people.” Pausing, Mom said, “God willing, we’ll meet in person once the surface is safe again.”

By the point, Caleb had lost interest in the conversation and walked off. Turning back to the transmitter, I said, “I guess he got bored; you know how 5 years old can be.”

“If he’s anything like how you were at that age, you and Ashley have your work cut out for you.” Taking a breath, Mom said, “Corporal Reyes isn’t sure how long the connection is going to last; as there’s a storm approaching our location. She thinks there’s enough time left for both families to speak.”

“I understand.”

After a moment another voice came over the speaker. “Hey, big brother.”

“Hey, Emma.” Chuckling, I said, “You have no idea how good it is to hear your voice.”

“Likewise.” Pausing, she said, “I was so worried that your last memory would be of me being angry with you.”

“I knew you weren’t angry with me, sis; you were having a rough time and needed someone to vent your frustration on.”

“Did you really marry that bitch Ashley Saunders, or was Mom pulling my leg.”

This time I noticed a scowl on Ashley’s face. Turning to the transmitter, I said, “Yes, Emma; Ashley and I are married. Please watch what you’re saying, as she’s right next to me.”

“I can’t believe you married her; I never pictured you having a thing for blondes.”

“Listen here, Emma; you don’t have to like it, but you damn well better accept the fact that I’m married to your brother.” Elbowing past me, Ashley said, “I know I wasn’t the nicest person in High School, but I’ve come a long way in the last 9 months.”

I had to step in before Ashley said something she would regret. Taking the transmitter from her, I silently gestured for her to step back. Once she obliged, I turned back to the transmitter and said, “I told you to watch what you say about Ashley; she’s my wife and I love her.”

“Sorry, Jamie.” Sighing, Emma said, “All I can remember is the crap she put me through in high school.”

I needed to cool off for a moment, but suddenly Dad’s voice came over the radio. “Don’t be so hard on your sister, Jamie.” Pausing, Dad said, “We’ve all be under a lot of stress here.”

“I understand that Dad; but I’m not going to stand by while she insults my wife.”

“Can we move past this, son?” sighing, Dad said, “We all thought you were dead until a short time ago, let’s not turn this reunion into a fight.”

“I’m sorry, Dad.” Sighing, trying to calm myself, I said, “I’m just overwhelmed by the fact that you’re all still alive. I was depressed for a week thinking you were all killed in that bus.”

“I wish we could talk some more, but time is short.” Pausing, Dad said, “Your mother wants to have a word with Ashley, then her folks want to speak with her. After that, if there’s time, one of the logistics officers here wants to go over your supply status.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Talking with the Family

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Walking up next to me, Ashley took the microphone and said, “I'm here, Mrs. Lincoln.”

There was a brief pause before Mom’s voice came back over the speaker. “Ashley, you’ve been...difficult, to say the least.”
“I know, ma’am; and can’t apologize enough for that.” Sighing, Ashley said, “If you catch me at the wrong time of the month, I’m still difficult.”

“If you’re anything like me on those days, it’s patience you're short on, not rationality. I’m afraid I can’t forget the way you were; but for the sake of my son, and my new grandson, I can forgive you. Promise me you’ll take good care of my boy.”
“I will, Mrs. Lincoln; you have my word.”

“I call my mother-in-law Mom, Ashley; not Mrs. Lincoln.”

A smile on her face, Ashley said, “Yes, Mrs...Mom.”

Just then another woman’s voice came over the speaker. “Ashley, sweetheart, it’s so good to hear from you again. Your father and I feared the worst.”

“I’m fine, Mom; we’re safe in the bunker under the house.”

"Did I hear you were down there with that awful Lincoln boy?"

“Jamie isn't awful, Mom.” Giving me one of those I’m sorry looks, Ashley said, “He's my husband, and I love him.”

“But he’s not even our sort, dear.”
“He came looking for me, Mom; which is something that my ex, who did meet your approval, couldn’t be bothered to do.” Sighing, Ashley said, “If that doesn’t change your opinion of Jamie, then I feel sorry for you.”

There was a long silence that made me think the connection had been lost; until a man’s voice came up next. “Hello Ashley, how have you been holding up in our back-up plan?"

"We’re fine, Dad; it’s been tough at times, but we’re surviving.” Pausing, Ashley said, “Uncle Patrick paid us a visit.”
I swear I heard an audible gasp over the speakers. “Is everything okay?"

“Your security measures kept him from getting inside.” Looking at me, Ashley said, “He was leading a pack of cannibals; they were going to kill Jamie and Caleb, then feed them to me."

“At least we won’t have to worry about him anymore. Although, I would have loved to see the look on his face when he got my surprise.”

After a few more minutes of Ashley talking with her step-dad, I heard another voice come over the speaker. “Jamie, this is Lt. Heidicker. I'd like you to give me some idea of your supplies if you can."

I gave him an idea of how many supplies were already in place at the bunker, what we brought with us when we came down, and what we'd used up or given to Caleb's family.

"Well, it sounds like you've got a good supply, kid. You should be set at least until we give the all-clear." He started breaking up. "I think that's about it for now... your frequency... when we can." That was all we could hear until the storm blew over.

For the first time in years, a storm didn't frighten me. I had talked to my family. They were alive. And, if we weren't all on good terms yet, we had time to make up.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It had been almost an hour since we lost contact with the bunker; Ashley and I were still trying to process everything. I was sitting at the kitchen counter eating some breakfast when Ashley came over to join me. Kissing me, she said, “I’m sorry about what my Mom said about you.”

“After everything that my mom said about you, I guess it’s only fair that it happened to me.” Putting the spoon down, I said, “I do appreciate that you stuck up for me, though.”

“What kind of person would I be if I didn’t defend my husband?” sitting next to me, Ashley said, “If my mom can’t see that you’re a great guy then so be it; I’ll still love you no matter what.”

“If you don’t mind my asking, why did you call your step-father Dad?”

“My biological father ran out on my mom a few months after I was born; he’s the only father I’ve ever known.” Sighing, Ashley said, “Although, if I’m being honest, I sometimes think he could do a lot better than my mom.”

“I can believe that; she does come off as being a little snobbish.”

“At least your Mom’s opinion of me has changed.” Chuckling, Ashley looked at me and said, “Besides, you’re not the first person whose mother-in-law didn’t like them.”

“I suppose you’re right.” Leaning over, I kissed Ashley and said, “Besides, I couldn’t care less about that; all I care about is the fact
that my family is alive.”

“It’s funny that you mention that; because I can’t help but think about the family who took their place.” Sighing, Ashley said, “If I hadn’t gone off to charge my phone, they would still be alive.”

“They’d be alive, but my family and I wouldn’t be.” Looking at Ashley, I said, “Your selfish need to charge your phone saved not only my life but the lives of my family.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Later That Morning

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
We were doing some of our regular chores when, later that afternoon, Corporal Reyes got back in touch. “How did you do with those storms, Jamie? Your mom, uh, mentioned that you’re not a fan of them.”

“I actually didn’t mind this one at all.” Smiling, I said, “After thinking my family was dead, talking to them put me in a good mood that no storm could break.”

“If you don’t mind my asking, Jamie; how have you guys managed to hold up on the sanity front?” pausing, she said, “We’ve had the occasional issue down here; we’d love it if you had some way of dealing with it.”

“It’s nothing too outlandish, Corporal; we’ve got our jobs and we do them. When we’re not working, we sing, play games, and watch movies.” Chuckling at the thought, I said, “Although, to be honest, I’m starting to regret teaching Ashley how to play chess.”

“Don’t listen to him, Corporal.” Appearing next to me, Ashley said, “He’s only saying that because I started beating him.”

“Beyond that, we just try to stay happy and healthy.” Pausing, I said, “We’ve given 'blowing off steam' a whole new meaning."

“And that's what does it for you?"

“We’ve had the occasional flare-up, but it’s worked pretty well so far.” Glancing at Ashley, I said, “You're welcome to try it if you want."

“To think we made fun of folks for bringing that stuff with them. It seems to have worked for you guys.”

“I’ve been dealing with a new problem since we spoke last.” Grabbing the mic, Ashley sat down on the couch and said, “Ever since we found out Jamie’s family got switched with another one, I’ve been wondering what might’ve happened if I’d been more responsible.”

“You mean besides your husband and in-laws being killed?” pausing, Corporal Reyes said, “You said Caleb and his folks were on their last legs when they found you. What would have happened to them if you hadn’t been there?”

Ashley shivered. We both knew exactly what would happen had we not been here. “Forgive me, Corporal; but I’m going to go hug my son now.”

“Please, Ashley; call me Elena.”

“Okay, Elena.”

After Ashley walked off, I turned back to the radio and said, “Thanks for helping her with that, Elena; it’s been bumming her out all day.”

“Try not to think of it as missing your chance to be here, guy; believe me, this place isn’t perfect.” Sighing, Elena said, “Just think it as the two of you needing to be at that bunker. Appalachia out."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Mid-Afternoon Contact

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After ending communications with Appalachia, I went to go check on Ashley. Sure enough, I found her lying on Caleb’s bed, holding him close in her arms. Walking into the room, I sat next to them on the bed as they both leaned against me. I had chores to do, but at this moment all I cared about was being there for my wife and son.

“Elena’s right, Ash; you shouldn’t blame yourself for what happened. We needed to be here; not holed up underground with our families.”

“That’s easy for you to say, Jamie; you don’t have to live with the knowledge that you indirectly killed an innocent family.”

“What do you think would have happened otherwise?” looking at her, I said, “I’d be dead, and you’d be stuck in a relationship with Eric. Not to mention, Caleb and his parents would’ve encountered your uncle’s group.”

“When you say it that way, I guess you have a point.”

After sitting there for another couple minutes, I got up and said, “I don’t know about you, but I could use some relaxation.”

“How about a game of chess?” with a grin, Ashley said, “Maybe I’ll even let you win this time.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Our weekly check-in with Appalachia went off without a hitch; we got some one-on-one time with our families, while I also talked with Ashley’s parents. Her Mom still didn’t think very highly of me; but that didn’t stop her from thanking me for keeping her safe.

Her dad on the other hand was much more amicable. He not only expressed his gratitude for saving Ashley’s life, and continuing to keep her safe; but he also gave his blessing for our wedding. “I’m an old-fashioned man, Jamie; I would’ve preferred that you asked my permission first, but under the circumstances I’ll let that slide.”

“That means a lot, Mr. Saunders; thank you.” Smiling, I said, “Along with Caleb, your daughter is the most important person in the world to me.”

“So tell me, how’s my bunker holding up?”

“It’s held up quite well, sir; we’ve only had a few instances where something broke.” Pausing, I said, “We’ve found a way to improve the output of the hydroponic garden by 15%; by converting the chicken’s waste a liquid fertilizer that we then mix into the system.”

“Somehow I suspect that was Ashley’s idea.” Chuckling, Mr. Saunders said, “I always knew she was smart; she just needed to put in the effort.”

“Well when you’re stuck in an underground bunker for 3 years, you have no choice but to put in the effort.”

I heard a faint voice over the speaker; it sounded as if someone was talking to Mr. Saunders. “We’ve only got a few minutes left, Brian; but Corporal Rojas wants to speak with you.”

“Understood, sir.”

After a brief pause, Elena’s voice came over the speakers. “Are you there, Jamie?”

“Yeah, I’m here; what’s up, Elena?”

“Nothing, I just thought I’d say hi.” Pausing, Elena said, “Between you and me; it’s nice to talk with someone different for a change.”

“I can’t argue with that.” Sighing, I said, “I love Ashley and Caleb; but it’s hard to strike up a new conversation with them.”

“Ever since you made contact, I’ve heard nothing but good things from your families about you guys.” Chuckling, Elena said, “I can’t wait to meet you guys in person.”

“Same here, Elena; perhaps next week we can actually take the time to get to know each other.”

“I’d like that.” After a brief pause, Elena said, “Well it’s that time again; see you next week.”

“Take care, Elena.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Weekly Contact with Appalachia (Day 297)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Ashley walked into the kitchen late one morning. Looking at me, she said, “Can we talk?”

I’m not going to lie, I got worried whenever Ashley said those words; after all, the last time was when she thought she was late. Looking at her, I said, “What about?"

"Caleb.” Sitting next to me, Ashley said, “I think we've been neglecting something important."

Putting down my lunch, I said, “We're with him almost all day.” A little confused, I said, “What could we possibly be neglecting?”

“He’s five years old, Jamie; we were in Kindergarten at that age.”

“I think we’d be hard-pressed to get him into a school, Ash.” Pausing, I said, “The sun’s hardly ever out anymore.”

Grabbing a water bottle from the fridge, Ashley said, “Be that as it may, we haven’t been keeping up with his education.” Opening the bottle, she said, “Social Services would take Caleb away from us if the world was still running; and honestly, I think they’d be right to do so.”

I quickly realized that Ash had a point. While we’d had a lot of fun with Caleb, and he’d learned a lot about caring for poultry and gardening; but we had no idea if he could read, write or if he can even do basic math.

I swear the kid knew when we were talking about him because at that point came walking out from is room. “What’s going on?”

“We’ve been talking about you, kiddo; we realized that we’ve been neglecting your education.” Pausing, I said, “Since we can’t send you to school, we’ll need to take care of that by ourselves.”

"Oh, okay.” Shrugging, he said, “How do we do that?”

“I was thinking we’d start with your letters and numbers.” Kneeling in front of Caleb, Ashley said, “Once you’ve got that down, we’ll teach you how to read, write and count like us. "

Caleb seemed to accept what was going on, so he walked over and sat down on the couch. As I went back to eating my lunch, I said, “I’ll ask Appalachia, next week, if they can give us some advice about teaching.”

“That could work.” Pausing, Ashley said, “Maybe we can see about getting him into a kindergarten class over the radio.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Ashley Voices Concerns About Caleb (Day 300)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Despite neither of us having any teaching experience, I think Ashley and I did a good job on Caleb’s first day of school. We split the duties between us; Ashley took the alphabet while I took the numbers.

I’d always suspected that Caleb was able to read a little bit; because he didn’t have any problems finding a particular movie to watch. Ashley always thought it was because he recognized the labels; but, after seeing that he recognized a fair amount of letters, she realized I was right. That made me wonder if his parents had enrolled him in daycare or preschool before the world went to hell.

After a quick lunch, it was my turn to teach him. This was where we ran into a little difficulty; he was able to count to six without issue but couldn't count to ten. He grew more agitated with each failed attempt; until, at one point, he started crying. I had to stop my lessons and go over to comfort him. Coming down to his level, I wiped his tears and said, “Caleb, it’s alright; you’ll get there.” Looking around to see if Ashley was nearby, I leaned closer and said, “Between you and me; I had trouble with my numbers too.”

“Y-You did?” sniffling, Caleb said, “B-But you’re the smartest person I know.”

“I appreciate the vote of confidence, buddy; but I’m not that smart.” Smiling, I said, “I’ve never told her this, but I think your mother is smarter than me. She’s certainly smarter than she gives herself credit for.”

I didn’t realize Ashley had walked back into the room; until I heard her say, “Don’t sell yourself short, babe; after all my 1450 SAT score is pretty meaningless right now.” Seeing the tears on Caleb’s face, Ashley walked over and said, “What’s going on here?”

“We got a little frustrated with the numbers; but I think we’ll be fine.” Checking the clock, I said, “In fact, I think now’s a good time to end for the day.”

“Yay!” a smile on his face, Caleb said, “Can I watch a movie?”

“Not until your chores are finished.” With a semi-stern tone, Ashley said, “I saw about a half-dozen eggs in the coop. After you pick them up, feed the chickens, and then you can watch a movie.”
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Bunker School (Day 302)

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
It was time, once again, for our weekly contact with Appalachia. Ashley and I had just finished giving status reports to various department heads, so it was time to chat with our folks. I was making a cup of instant coffee when Ashley came walking over to me, a worried look on her face. “So, uh, my mom wants to talk with you.”

Knowing full well that Ashley’s mom didn’t approve of me, I couldn’t help but worry about what was going to come next. “Did she say about what?”

“No, she just said she wanted to talk with you.”

With Ashley following behind me, for support, I walked over to the radio. Grabbing hold of the microphone, I said, “Mrs. Saunders?”

Given her opinion of me, I wasn’t surprised when she didn’t say hello or anything like that. Instead, with a bit of an attitude, she said, “What makes you think you’re even remotely worthy of my daughter?”
